results.title: [Washing machine: Santa]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. When people co-habit there are usually differences in how we choose to live. Santa and his live-in unicorn ‘creature’ have theirs because what is one person’s washing machine is another’s Jacuzzi.

results.title: Hue and cry
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Henry Cornelius, Sir Michael Balcon, Rank Film Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
While reading a hair-rasing serial in the magazine “The Trump”, 15 year-old Joe Kirby finds that his over-active imagination has exceeded itself and he lands right in the middle of the story. Joe convinces himself and friends that the magazine installments are being used as a means of secret communication by a masterly gang of criminals. Starring Alastair Sim, Jack Warner, Valerie White and Jack Lambert.

results.title: Over in 3 weeks
results.creator_credit: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started. In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.

results.title: The Ladykillers
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A black comedy from the Ealing Studios which features Alec Guinness and Peter Sellers. An innocent little old lady who takes in a sinister lodger finds out that he and four friends have committed a robbery. Once they realise she knows everything, they plot to kill her. However, just because she is the archetypal genteel old lady pensioner, doesn’t mean that she is quite as harmless as she seems. Also stars Jack Warner, Katie Johnson and Frankie Howerd.

results.title: My brother's birthday
results.creator_credit: Max Hammond, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Syria, on the way to Beirut, Max Hammond’s thoughts turned to his family. One of seven children, Hammond and his three brothers served together in World War II. He recounts a close call that occurred on his brother’s birthday and reflects on how lucky he and his brothers are.

results.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
results.creator_credit: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
When an antiquated railway line is threatened with closure, the villagers decide to run it themselves, entering into frenzied competition with the local bus route. Stanley Holloway as Mr Valentine, the village soak, becomes the railway benefactor and sets the wheels in motion. The antics of this eccentric rural community will provide a comic treat, while train lovers will appreciate the quest to save an old steam engine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Crichton, Michael Truman, Michael Balcon Productions and Ealing Studios

results.title: The Cruel sea
results.creator_credit: Charles Frend, Leslie Norman and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A powerful moving documentary-style account of life on board a British warship during World War II. It is the courageous story of the battle of the Atlantic, a story of ocean, a shipand a handful of men. The only villain is the sea, that man and war have made even more brutal. Based on the novel by Nicholas Monsarrat and stars Jack Hawkins, Donald Sinden, Denholm Elliot and Virginia McKenna.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Frend, Leslie Norman and Ealing Studios

results.title: The Washing machine
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. A man is spied upon by a mischievous elephant as he walks through the hot summer landscape. The elephant proceeds to have fun with the man by skirting him and rolling him flat on the ground. Intended as a visual play on the physical differences of man and elephant.

results.title: School for scoundrels
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Hal E. Chester, Guardsman Film Productions and ABP
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Amusing British comedy about a constant “loser” (Ian Carmichael) who enrols in Alistair Sim’s School of Lifemanship” and there learns all the tricks to allow him to win the girl and get the better of two unscrupulous used car salesmen (Dennis Price and Peter Jones) as well as his rival in love and on the tennis court, Terry Thomas. Based on the book by Stephen Potter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Hamer, Hal E. Chester, Guardsman Film Productions and ABP
